author: Al

review: This product worked fine at the start. I have a strong WIFI connection (> 50 Mbps), and the stick was plugged in and powered. However, numerous times, the audio would stop working. Doing a reboot, unplugging the device, many times didn't fix the problem. Other times, the screen would flicker a lot. Unplugging and plugging the stick back in solved that, but it meant every time I wanted to sit down and watch something, I had to do this. I thought this would be a good replacement for cable TV, but it is not. It is not a refined product, but what do you expect for $35 ? Amazon did not spend much time fixing the SW & HW bugs here and you can tell. It is not worth the aggravation. It's better to just watch Netflix or Hulu on a laptop. The idea of putting a fast processor in a stick is nice, but you need to do the quality SW development and HW integration to back it up. This is not something which Amazon did.

review: Coming from a die hard Roku fan. This is my second Fire Stick. Easy to set up and use. And if you travel, it's great to take along. Connects easily, even to hotel wifi systems.Comes preconfigured to your Amazon account, or you can start fresh. Remote is RF, so you don't have to be pointing it at the device. Of course, it works great with Prime, and with Kindle devices to connect to a 'Second Screen'. Also works better with a Slingbox than Roku, no smartphone or tablet needed.
